name: Methi Paratha
history: Methi Paratha, originating from the Indian subcontinent, is a traditional flatbread made with fenugreek leaves. It combines the nutritional benefits of fenugreek (methi) with the beloved preparation of paratha.
description: Methi Paratha is a flavorful flatbread made by incorporating fresh or dried fenugreek leaves into whole wheat dough. The parathas are seasoned with spices and cooked on a griddle. They're known for their distinct taste and health benefits.

instructions.title: Prepare the Dough
instructions.description: In a mixing bowl, combine whole wheat flour, chopped methi leaves, ajwain, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Gradually add water and knead into a soft dough. Let it rest for 15 minutes.

instructions.title: Roll and Cook the Parathas
instructions.description: Divide the dough into equal portions. Roll each portion into a circle. Heat a griddle and cook each paratha with ghee or oil until both sides have golden brown spots.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Serve the hot methi parathas with yogurt, pickle, or any curry of your choice.

tips: The dough should be soft and pliable for the best results.
Adjust the spice levels according to your preference.
variations: Add other greens like spinach or kale for a different flavor.
Stuff with spiced potatoes or paneer for a more filling meal.

storage.shelfLife: Best consumed fresh but can be stored in an airtight container for up to 24 hours.
storage.instructions: Reheat on a griddle before serving if stored.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on a hot griddle or tawa until warm and soft.
presentationTips: Serve in a basket lined with a cloth to keep them warm.
Pair with a variety of chutneys and curries for a complete meal.
